title: How to play Wukong mid without being called a troll
body: Lately I've been trying to get into Wukong mid and he's actually really good but people seem to think that it doesn't work. Today I tried playing a game as kong mid and the Yorick top and the Malphite support were telling me that it doesn't work and that I can't go Wukong, I got tired of arguing and gave in by going Kassadin but how can I convince people that Wukong mid works?

replies.body: Just do it, stomp the opponent and if you get %%%% mute them as soon as you enter the game easy and if they're insistent you're trolling, actually troll

> [{quoted}](name=DarkShade918,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=bzwJqTlB,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-02-12T00:47:02.499+0000)
>
> Just do it, stomp the opponent and if you get %%%% mute them as soon as you enter the game easy and if they're insistent you're trolling, actually troll

Don't actually troll. That is not the way to go. 
But the rest of what you say is good.
Play AP Wukoing. Everyone knows your not trolling if you play an AP Midlaner
Git gud, stomp people as Wu mid, prove you're not a troll.

> [{quoted}](name=Wiggy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=bzwJqTlB,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-11T19:07:27.297+0000)
>
> Git gud, stomp people as Wu mid, prove you're not a troll.

I've done that but I was mostly focused on trying to prove it champ select which might not be possible.

I guess if they know in the end it doesn't matter.
In champ select you can't prove anything, even the whole "check my history" comment doesn't bother most people
malphite support hahahahah what elo is this

"Just Do It" ~ Nike

I get a lot of sh!t when I pick Quinn. Usually I manage to shut those naysayers up by doing better than them. If you're confident using Wukong mid, use Wukong mid.
Quin is left in the dark for a reason
If you play wukong in any position and finish your sunfire + brutaliser theres a 90% chance you will win the game.

How to not be called a troll.
Practice with AI bot games ---> GO into normals ---> Rightfully call mid first and then select wukong and wait for a moments time, then auto-lock so hard your hands fall off ---> Ignore the pessimistic players --- > Smash mid.
People change their tone when they realize they are being carried by the person they thought would feed and if you react in a professional manner instead of "I told you so" or even be polite and optimistic people push themselves to do the best they can for the team.

Just do what you want. Eventually you will get into games where you can play your wukong mid and people wont dodge the lobby. Off meta picks ofter work well because no-one is expecting it and it throws them off their game a little bit.
 I play Orianna and Ahri support a lot (to practice my midlane champs because midlane is always taken). Despite not taking CS and building a sightstone, GP10 and whatever else my team needs before I build my damage items i generally get called a troll. Usually in lobbies people dodge or get really angry at me for but they can get over themselves and deal with it. At the end they usually change their stance and realise that if you are good at a champion you can play them anywhere with success. 

TL;DR Do whatever you want, new meta is created by people doing this sort of thing.

> [{quoted}](name=ViceVersaxD,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=bzwJqTlB,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-02-11T19:47:45.121+0000)
>
> Well if you play him against a really high "click to cast spell" champion like veigar, you can use the clone to dodge nearly all his damage. its not really about what you play mid (any champion can be played mid) it's the reasoning behind it.

Yeah it was funny, yesterday I played against a Ryze mid and I found out that since his rune prison is only a root (which means I can still cast spells that don't move myself) I can cast my clone while rooted and it'll tank all the damage for me.

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/78692347/200727054
I looked at his build path and realised he didn't have a full mastery page though. Although your point stands I don't think he is a good Ryze then :P

> [{quoted}](name=Slim Chaedi,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=bzwJqTlB,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-02-11T20:28:09.656+0000)
>
> I looked at his build path and realised he didn't have a full mastery page though. Although your point stands I don't think he is a good Ryze then :P

Yeah, I don't think he was that good either. I just found it interesting that I could negate his combo.
I would have gotten super frustrated if I were him and would only go in to attack you with my ult just in case, or something :P. I'm wondering what other midlaners that would work against though.

> [{quoted}](name=Slim Chaedi,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=bzwJqTlB,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-11T20:33:56.556+0000)
>
> I would have gotten super frustrated if I were him and would only go in to attack you with my ult just in case, or something :P. I'm wondering what other midlaners that would work against though.

Well if you can do a good clone then you can bait Yasuo into using his ult. You can also use your clone to body block a Fizz ult.

Also with skill shot stuns like Xerath's you can clone just before it gets you and he'll think he's stunned you. I've also baited many thresh hooks and slightly less blitz pulls.

Also this one time a Vayne fired her condemn at me and while it was traveling I cloned and got shot into the wall but because I was already standing by the wall she assumed the clone was me even though it wasn't stunned.

Well if you play him against a really high "click to cast spell" champion like veigar, you can use the clone to dodge nearly all his damage. its not really about what you play mid (any champion can be played mid) it's the reasoning behind it.
you could play him jungle like some korean pros do. but if youre high ranked player people wont argue with you

> [{quoted}](name=sako,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=bzwJqTlB,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-02-11T19:31:04.279+0000)
>
> you could play him jungle like some korean pros do. but if youre high ranked player people wont argue with you

I get bored of playing him jungle, that's where I've played him the most.
mute
